title: Level 5 Cho asks for blue.  I give it to him.  30 seconds later "wtf gragas y u so oom"

> [{quoted}](name=X SkeletonCandy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ro2RWPJH,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-06-09T21:39:04.722+0000)

Though not nearly as bad now that some others have been pushed out of the op spot
Blue buff doesn't belong to midlaners. If they want mana, they can build mana regen too.

*shrugs*

Level 5 is a bit early to give out blue buff, just saying. Just like suggesting trailblazers for mana sustain, midlaners can build mana regen too.

> [{quoted}](name=Stovetop Chemist,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ro2RWPJH,comment-id=00060000000000000000,timestamp=2015-06-09T23:22:56.874+0000)
>
> The more gold you spend on mana regen/bigger mana pool, the less you have to invest in things that actually increase your damage output or tankiness and the less likely you are to win trades.
> 
> I guarantee you that mid mages need that mana regen and cdr more than 90% of the jungler champion pool. Should go without saying, really.

LEVEL.  FUCKING.  FIVE.

Yeah, mid to late game. Early game, junglers need the early mana regen and cdr much more than mid mages.

Second buff should usually go to the jungler (since they have to spam abilities to even clear, not last-hit and have minions soak up damage). Mana management is a skill mages need to learn, and they should not have to rely on blue buff to lane. Third buff and beyond *should* go to the mages, but only to supplement, not sustain, their laning abilities.

Depends of the jungler though, I mean even as a mana jungler, some of them autoattack more than spam skills, e.g. all the ADC junglers except Ez.  If I feel that I don't need the exp I often donate it to the mid or top laner if they got first blood as a "reward".

It really does depend on the jungler. If you have an AD bruiser and you're doing well, you don't really need blue buff all that much.

It's the ones that go oom quickly or are AP (Fiddlesticks and Ekko would definitely need at least the second blue buff).

It's also part of a risk assessment. Certain mages *need* to build cdr and mana regen first then AP, not have a pure AP build. Blue buff should never be a guarantee, considering that the blue buff can be invaded and stolen, or even taken from the mage in question if they die. As a jungle main, I will not give an early blue buff to a mage who cannot prove themselves responsible enough (like going oom too early when they aren't even being camped or harassed too much, don't respond appropriately to ganks, feed, don't ward, etc). But like you, I do "reward" them if they've proven themselves to be competent and I don't really rely on the thing.

But people with the "blue buff belongs to the midlaner!" mentality are kind of iffy with me. Some might be really good midlaners who are gods if they have the thing, and some just feel entitled and don't know how to manage their resource (I don't even MAIN mid and I can last-hit autos and manage my mana just fine whenever I go there, so I know that saying all midlaners need blue is a load of bull.).

Well, it is arguable that the mana hungry mages could RUSH their AP while getting blue buff to snowball their lane but errr... I don't really trust randoms unless I've seen their competency in mid lane from a few games. Still, they will eventually have to build their own mana regen, you can't expect to be useless for a whole 4 minutes while blue buff is still respawning. 

But arguing back and forth, it still boils down to one fact: ALL the camps are mine, because I have the {{summoner:11}} . If I really do not want to give the buff, you will not get it, even if you try. That's all.

Preach it, brotha.

Saddest thing in the world is when you give blue and they immediately die for some reason. :(

Because it's completely uniform for champions to have such poor base damages AND terrible mana economy that they must build damage specifically AND get blue.

More directly there are characters that need mana over straight ap early, they rely on using their hard to avoid spells to grind their target to dust. Example champions that do this are : Lux, Syndra, Vel'koz, Ziggs

Yes these characters LIKE to build AP, but the ability to cast more IS more damage. This applies mostly to champions who don't "Trade" they only "Give" damage.

Plus you want the 7 minute blue... Wtf I rather have a level 6 jungler k thx.

I feel as if people forgot {{item:3174}} exists.

it doesn't make you completely Blue Buff dependent with those champions, it also gives you a little damage and CDR, plus some survivability in the form of a little magic resist. 

while not every champion should build it, it helps tremendously on the mentioned champions.

> [{quoted}](name=ScarletSkolver,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ro2RWPJH,comment-id=0006000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2015-06-11T02:06:19.233+0000)

> 
> while not every champion should build it, it helps tremendously on the mentioned champions.

{{item:3174}} on {{champion:161}}  = RAPID FIRE DISINTEGRATION

Gonna have to agree. As someone who plays all positions relatively often, I know damn well that some junglers just can't clear without the blue buff. Even Rengar needs the blue buff early on for the CDR.

> [{quoted}](name=tombdragon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ro2RWPJH,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2015-06-09T21:54:08.775+0000)
>
> Blue buff doesn't belong to midlaners. If they want mana, they can build mana regen too.

Literally the dumbest thing I've ever read. Hope that was sarcasm. Lol.

Well... one could also say a mana hungry jungler could build a mana regen item too. however, for most part, these "mana hungry" junglers use mana so fast in fights, they'd rather have a bigger mana pool to finish then back to heal rather than waiting for mana regen. For those purposes, {{item:3057}} products, {{item:3110}} and {{item:3027}} are pretty much superior to mana regen items and for most part, those classified as "mana hungry" junglers can use at least one of these.
Have fun trying to out-damage my {{summoner:11}} when you're fucking oom because you think you're entitled to blue and didn't build any mana regen at all because of it.

How does Cho even run out of mana?
Wasn't he CSing?
just need some 20 minions to give back the mana for 1 Q.
Probably had a hard time in laning phase.
If that's the case, that cho didn't deserve blue, since _he_ should be the one giving the opponent a hard time during the laning phase.
Cho should never run out of mana unless he's an ability spamming scrub >.>

{{champion:266}}  You guys have no idea of my struggle. . . My abilities used to cost mana, but the abilities cost so much that they just started taking my blood instead. Mana wasn't enough, I guess. :(
First world problems...

if you're good at jungling, you don't give away blue buff until the laning phase is over

i told reginald to take a hike in season 4 when he wanted the 2nd blue buff

if i'm not going to give it to lcs level players, i'm definitely not giving it to random solo queue mid laners
lol :(
lol why would you give up blue to a champ who has mana sustain

I manage to run a very nice midlane swain, and I constantly turn down jg's offer's to donate blue. Don't spam spells to farm, rush a catalyst. It's not exactly hard to do. The RoA/AA combo has never been stronger. 

I also go 9/0/21 for masteries and have never had an issue with damage output as I regularly deal the highest damage to champions. That 1.5% max mana regen is brokenly strong. (Not to mention the extra gold allows you to buy AP items faster. Thus an earlier RoA for faster stacks for that mid-game power spike.)

 I don't know how many times I've see some mid-lane type "lolz I was oom" after dying and I think to myself, "Yeah building mana is worthless right? Sigh."

YES. SOMEONE ELSE WHO VALUES THE UTILITY TREE ON NON-SUPPORTS!

9/0/21 is a lategame setup imo, because lategame items cover any minor offenses lost from the offense tree and you get those items faster anyway from farm, and some of the things in utility, items can't provide (offense basically just means more damage which you can get from having more items anyway). I run it on {{champion:30}}
I  Don't really need mana{{champion:34}}
But Cho'Gath regains mana and health on every minion kill and has Doran's Ring to boost that?
